title: Favorite Support S6
body:
I have been slowly moving from Mid to Support over the years, and in spite of the myriad problems with the game, I feel like this season has had the most variety of viable support champs I've seen in a while.  Let's chat about the State of Support!  Who is your current favorite and why?

Edit:  Yes, there are only 10 spaces in Rito Polls.  Sorry if I missed your favorite.

So much Janna.

My team can make... questionable decisions, and I have the kit to go in after them and get people out alive.

How does Sona not make it but Brand does? Brand has 1 useful support ability, a single cc, meanwhile Sona has heals, shields, auto empowerment, a stun and a slow, a micro-exhaust, and a movespeed buff. Also Her Q is arguably one of the best poking abilities in the game with auto targeting and then an auto to deal rather _noice_ amounts of damage with little to no AP, and then scaling extremely well throughout the rest of the match. If you hadn't guessed, she's my favourite Support. Admittedly, she can be pretty easy to play, which frankly I like. It's less stressful. Like the opposite of playing Kalista or Draven. She's just so versatile, engaging disengaging poking sustaining, the only thing she cant do is push lanes quickly. Ok, and play against Fizz, nobody can do that. Like seriously though. What's with that Fizz E. Zhonyas+Mobility on a cooldown 80% smaller(may not be accurate) like what even is that. You couldn't get that much safety and reliablity if your Barrier was on a 4 second cooldown.
